    66= Tasks =
    7  1. Create a MySQL database with provided movie info (on your development machine);
    87 1. Setup Apache Tomcat (on your development machine);
    98 1. Setup an Amazon AWS instance and repeat tasks 1-3 on the instance.
    109 1. Join Github Organization and create a repo for your team.

    14 = Task 1: Create a MySQL Database =
    15  * Download a MySQL database for your development machine from http://dev.mysql.com/downloads/mysql/;
    16  * Create a database called "moviedb" with the following tables:[[BR]]
    1714
    18 || Table Name[[BR]] || Attributes[[BR]] || Notes ||
    19 || movies[[BR]] || !id:varchar(10) (primary key)[[BR]] !title:varchar(100) [[BR]] !year:integer [[BR]] !director:varchar(100) [[BR]] || required [[BR]] required [[BR]] required [[BR]] required ||
    20 || stars[[BR]] || !id:varchar(10) (primary key)[[BR]] !name:varchar(100) [[BR]] !birthYear:integer [[BR]] || required[[BR]] required [[BR]] not required[[BR]] ||
    21 || stars_in_movies[[BR]] || !starId:varchar(10]), referencing stars.id[[BR]] !movieId:varchar(10]), referencing movies.id[[BR]] || all attributes required ||
    22 || genres[[BR]] || !id:integer (primary key)[[BR]] !name:varchar(32) [[BR]] || all attributes required; "id" should be [[BR]]"AUTO_INCREMENT" ||
    23 || genres_in_movies[[BR]] || !genreId:integer, referencing genres.id[[BR]] !movieId:varchar(10]), referencing movies.id[[BR]] || all attributes required ||
    24 || customers[[BR]] || !id:integer (primary key)[[BR]] !firstName:varchar(50) [[BR]] !lastName:varchar(50) [[BR]] !ccId:varchar(20), referencing creditcards.id[[BR]] !address:varchar(200) [[BR]] !email:varchar(50) [[BR]] !password:varchar(20) [[BR]] || all attributes required; "id" should be [[BR]]"AUTO_INCREMENT" ||
    25 || sales[[BR]] || !id:integer (primary key)[[BR]]       !customerId:integer, referencing customers.id[[BR]] !movieId:varchar(10), referencing movies.id[[BR]] !saleDate:date  [[BR]] || all attributes required; "id" should be [[BR]]"AUTO_INCREMENT" ||
    26 || creditcards[[BR]] || !id:varchar(20), (primary key)[[BR]] !firstName:varchar(50) [[BR]] !lastName:varchar(50) [[BR]] !expiration:date [[BR]] || all attributes required ||
    27 
    28 The table-creation SQL statements should be written in a '''createtable.sql''' file.  All varchar() fields for which there is no data (i.e., the fields contents are missing or unknown) are the empty string (!''); other non-required fields which have no data are null. Required fields have the constraint that they are not null. [[BR]] [[BR]]
    29 
    30  * Use the provided [attachment:data.sql] file to populate the tables.

    6649Apache Tomcat makes hosting your applications easy. The Eclipse IDE makes development easy. Important: You may use Eclipse version 3.1 or higher.  We recommend you to use Eclipse EE (EE stands for Enterprise Edition and has built-in support for application and web servers including Tomcat)

    8265[[Span(id=setup-aws)]]You need to launch an Amazon [https://aws.amazon.com/console/ AWS instance] to repeat the tasks above. Make sure to use the '''free-tier 64-bit Ubuntu instances''' so that we can make our future instructions consistent. You are welcome to participate in the ​[https://aws.amazon.com/education/awseducate/ AWS Educate] program, which can provide $100 AWS credits per student. (I believe UCI is a member institution.)

    108 = Task 4: Join Github Organization and create a repo for your team. =
     91= Task 3: Join Github Organization and create a repo for your team. =
    10992This course uses Github for version control. The students are expected to use Github as explained below.
    11093
    111  * Students will need to signup on Github. After signing up they need to provide us their usernames and signup for teams [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1B0eu9Zt5gtaHdBFMnPnYb1mYzzpBPUcEKjmeGEiRC6E/edit?usp=sharing here].
    112  * The students will be added to [https://github.com/UCI-Chenli-teaching UCI-Chenli-teaching repository].
    113  * One member from each team will create a private repository there. The repository name should be of the form 'cs122b-winter18-team-x' where x is your team number. Other members can then be added to the repository as collaborators (by following steps given [https://help.github.com/articles/inviting-collaborators-to-a-personal-repository/ here]).
    114  * You can then begin with your project.
     94 * Create an account on Github if you don't have one. Then provide us your username in the Google Doc [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1B0eu9Zt5gtaHdBFMnPnYb1mYzzpBPUcEKjmeGEiRC6E/edit?usp=sharing here].
     95 * Wait for the invitation to join the [https://github.com/UCI-Chenli-teaching UCI-Chenli-teaching organization]. The invitation might take a few days to be sent out.
     96 * One member from each team needs to create a '''private''' repository. The repository name should be of the form 'cs122b-winter18-team-x' where x is your team number. For example, "cs122b-winter18-team-1". Other members can then be added to the repository as collaborators (by following steps given [https://help.github.com/articles/inviting-collaborators-to-a-personal-repository/ here]).
     97 * You can then begin with your project using Git and Github. Put the code of your project in your team's Github repository.

     100*  https://try.github.io
     101*  https://product.hubspot.com/blog/git-and-github-tutorial-for-beginners

    145 You are recommend to implement project 1 using the Java servlet technique covered in the class. The purpose is that 1) having a perspective on the history of web technology and 2) it is easier to learn during Project 1's small amount of time.

    149138= Grading Checklist =
    … …  
    151140
    152141= Project Submission =
    153 Pack all the required files in a single zip file to include the following:[[BR]]
    154142
    155  * All source code (*.java, *.sql, and so on, excluding binary files such as .class files and .exe files), this includes the SQL commands you issued to create the database and populate it.
     143* We'll take your Github code as submissions. You need to include all the code in your Github repository, including Java, SQL, HTML, CSS, etc..
     144* You don't have to submit anything on EEE.
     145* On the night of the end of the grace period, we will run a GitHub script which will get the latest commit in the repository.
     146* We'll use the time of the latest commit to determine if you use the Grace Period or not. So if you don't plan to use the Grace Period, don't push anything to Github on the 24-hour Grace Period.
     147* Any commits after the grace period will be ignored. You can continue using your repository normally for the next project.
     148* Remember that we will only be checking the code in the master branch of your repository.
     149* Do not try to cheat by modifying the timestamp of the commits to an earlier date. We'll use the time that you push your commits to Github. So be sure to push your changes to Github before the deadline!
     150* To avoid any surprises, we will be publishing the final commit number that we have recorded for every team. If any team thinks we have made a mistake, they are welcome to contact us.
    156151
    157   '''                          Each group will be assigned a unique group ID, which should be used to name your files and submission. In particular, your submission zip file should be named "project1_[2-digt-groupid].zip" For example, the file for group 9 should be "project1_09.zip". The submission should include at least one .sql file: createtable_[2-digt-groupid].sql (such as "createtable_09.sql" for group 09)  to include all the "CREATE TABLE" SQL statements.'''
    158152
    159   '''                          Each group MUST follow this naming requirement.'''
    160 
    161   Those script files should be directly executable by being fed as input to the mysql command.[[BR]]
    162 
    163   '''                                      mysql -u root -p -D moviedb <  createtable.sql'''                                      [[BR]]
    164 
    165  * '''The ssh private key file (.pem) of your AWS instance.''' [[BR]]
    166  * Makefiles and ant build files if you use make or ant to build you project. [[BR]]
    167  * A readme file specifying how to compile and run your program
    168  * '''Note:''' Checking constraints is '''not''' a requirement of the project.
    169 
    170 If your project does not compile or if your SQL scripts generate errors such a project will get a very low score if any. [[BR]]
    171 
    172 Login onto EEE using your UCInetID. Under our course COMPSCI 122B, click Dropbox. Under Folder View, click CS122B Proj 1/Assignment Submission. Upload your zip file there. Please notice that after the deadline you will not be able to upload your files to the system any more.
    173153
    174154= Demonstration =
    175155'''You are required to demonstrate  this project'''. Create a running system from your ZIP file–quickly. Show the correctness, completeness, functionality and performance of your database during your demonstration by using the employee interface developed here. Your task is to convince us '''(in 15 minutes)''' that your work is correctly and completely carried out and the course project is ready to move to phase 2. Your demo will include the following:
    176156
    177 a) Setup your application '''using the files you submitted on EEE'''. The TA/grader will upload these files on your PC. You must have already installed MySQL.
     157How will grading be done-
     158
     159 * The team will login to the AWS instance.
     160 * They will be required to checkout to the commit id that we have and show us their running code.
     161
     162a) Logon to your AWS instance and checkout your code to the commit ID that we recorded. Then start your application based on it. You should already installed everything (MySQL, Tomcat, etc...) on the AWS and make sure your application can be started quickly.
    178163
    179164b) Demonstrate that your '''''creatable.sql''''' file creates a valid database. Since execution of the '''''data.sql''''' can take too long, you should have already setup a database and populate it. This database will be the one accessed by your demonstrated JDBC program. Thus, '''''creatable.sql''''' will be executed for a  database under a different name and get populated by executing '''''data.sql''''', while you are demonstrating other parts of the project.
    … …  
    181166c) Demonstrate the correctness, completeness, and performance of all the required features.
    182167
    183 d) Last but not least, entering YOUR_PUBLIC_[IP:8080 IP:8080] on your AWS instance should show us the Tomcat application manager, which confirms that you are running Tomcat on the AWS instance. Additionally, the TA/Reader may want to use his username (with the password that you provide) to access the instance through SSH.
     168d) Last but not least, entering YOUR_PUBLIC_[IP:8080 IP:8080] on your AWS instance should show us the Tomcat application manager, which confirms that you are running Tomcat on the AWS instance.
    184169
    185170Please note that '''you will have no more than 15 min to demonstrate'''.  It is completely up to you to plan your demo so that all the required features are displayed and the grader  can be convinced of the quality of your work in the given time frame.''' If a group's demonstration appears to be unstructured, the demo could be aborted and rescheduled for another time''' with a substantial '''grade penalty'''.
